pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.4.eng: The number of offenses within each offense

pli-tv-pvr1.2:0.5.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.1.eng: When having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2.pli: Methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3.pli: Akkhāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.3.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4.pli: yebhuyyena khāyite sarīre methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.4.eng: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5.pli: vaṭṭakate mukhe acchupantaṃ aṅgajātaṃ paveseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa—
pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.5.eng: when one inserts one’s penis into a wide open mouth without touching it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:1.6.pli: methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanto imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.1.eng: When stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3.pli: Pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.3.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth five māsaka coins or more, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4.pli: atirekamāsakaṃ vā ūnapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.4.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one māsaka coin but less than five, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5.pli: māsakaṃ vā ūnamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa—
pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.5.eng: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth one māsaka coin or less, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:2.6.pli: adinnaṃ ādiyanto imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1.pli: Sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropento kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.1.eng: When intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2.pli: Sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3.pli: Manussaṃ odissa opātaṃ khaṇati “papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.3.eng: when one digs a pit for a human being, thinking, “Falling into it, they will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4.pli: papatite dukkhā vedanā uppajjati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.4.eng: when they experience pain after falling in, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.5.eng: when they die, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:3.6.pli: sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropento imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1.pli: Asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.1.eng: When claiming a non-existent superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2.pli: Asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.2.eng: One commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3.pli: Pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.3.eng: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4.pli: “yo te vihāre vasati, so bhikkhu arahā”ti bhaṇati, paṭivijānantassa āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.4.eng: when one says, “The monk who stays in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.5.eng: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:4.6.pli: asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanto imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:5.1.eng: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1.pli: (…) Upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.1.eng: (…) When emitting semen by means of effort, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.2.eng: when one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3.pli: ceteti upakkamati na muccati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.3.eng: when one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:6.4.eng: for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.1.eng: When making physical contact with a woman, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.2.eng: when one makes physical contact, body with body, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.3.eng: when one makes physical contact with something connected to her body, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:7.4.eng: when one, with something connected to one’s own body, makes physical contact with something connected to her body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1.pli: Mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.1.eng: When speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2.pli: Vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati, avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.2.eng: when, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises or disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3.pli: vaccamaggaṃ passāvamaggaṃ ṭhapetvā adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.3.eng: when, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises or disparages, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4.pli: kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ ādissa vaṇṇampi bhaṇati avaṇṇampi bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:8.4.eng: when, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises or disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1.pli: Attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.1.eng: When encouraging the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2.pli: Mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.2.eng: when one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3.pli: paṇḍakassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.3.eng: when one encourages a paṇḍaka to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4.pli: tiracchānagatassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:9.4.eng: when one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.1.eng: When acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.2.eng: when one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3.pli: paṭiggaṇhāti vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.3.eng: when one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4.pli: paṭiggaṇhāti na vīmaṃsati na paccāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:10.4.eng: when one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1.pli: Saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kārāpento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.1.eng: When having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.2.eng: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.3.eng: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:11.4.eng: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kārāpento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.1.eng: When having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.2.eng: when one is having it built, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.3.eng: when there is one piece left to complete the dwelling, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:12.4.eng: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.1.eng: When groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2.pli: Anokāsaṃ kārāpetvā cāvanādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.2.eng: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3.pli: okāsaṃ kārāpetvā akkosādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti omasavādassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:13.3.eng: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsento tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.1.eng: When charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2.pli: Anokāsaṃ kārāpetvā cāvanādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.2.eng: when, without having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3.pli: okāsaṃ kārāpetvā akkosādhippāyo vadeti, āpatti omasavādassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:14.3.eng: when, having gotten his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1.pli: Saṅghabhedako bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.1.eng: When not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:15.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1.pli: Bhedakānuvattakā bhikkhū yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantā tisso āpattiyo āpajjanti.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.1.eng: When not stopping when pressed for the third time, monks who side with a monk who is pursuing schism commit three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.2.eng: after the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:16.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1.pli: Dubbaco bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.1.eng: When not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is difficult to correct commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:17.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1.pli: Kuladūsako bhikkhu yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanto tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.1.eng: When not stopping when pressed for the third time, a monk who is a corrupter of families commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.2.eng: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:18.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:19.1.eng: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.0.2.eng: The subchapter on the robe season

pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.1.pli: Atirekacīvaraṃ dasāhaṃ atikkāmento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.1.eng: When keeping an extra robe more than ten days, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:20.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.1.pli: Ekarattaṃ ticīvarena vippavasanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.1.eng: When staying apart from one’s three robes for one day, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:21.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.1.pli: Akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā māsaṃ atikkāmento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.1.eng: When receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:22.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.1.eng: When having an unrelated nun wash a used robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.2.eng: when one is having it washed, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:23.3.eng: when one has had it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthato cīvaraṃ paṭiggaṇhanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.1.eng: When receiving a robe directly from an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.2.eng: when one is in the process of taking it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:24.3.eng: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.1.pli: Aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.1.eng: When asking an unrelated male or female householder for a robe, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.2.eng: when one is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:25.3.eng: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.1.pli: Aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā tatuttari cīvaraṃ viññāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.1.eng: When asking an unrelated male or female householder for too many robes, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.2.eng: when one is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:26.3.eng: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.1.pli: Pubbe appavārito aññātakaṃ gahapatikaṃ upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.1.eng: When, without first being invited, one goes to an unrelated householder and specifies the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.2.eng: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:27.3.eng: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.1.pli: Pubbe appavārito aññātake gahapatike upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.1.eng: When, without first being invited, one goes to unrelated householders and specifies the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.2.eng: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:28.3.eng: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.1.pli: Atirekatikkhattuṃ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṃ ṭhānena cīvaraṃ abhinipphādento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.1.eng: When getting robe-cloth after prompting more than three times and standing more than six times, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.2.eng: when one is in the process of getting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:29.3.eng: when one has gotten it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:30.1.eng: The first subchapter on the robe season is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.1.pli: Kosiyamissakaṃ santhataṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.1.eng: When having a blanket made that contains silk, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:31.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.1.pli: Suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.1.eng: When having a blanket made entirely of black wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:32.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.1.pli: Anādiyitvā tulaṃ odātānaṃ tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.1.eng: When having a new blanket made without using one measure of white wool and one measure of brown, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:33.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.1.pli: Anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.1.eng: When having a blanket made every year, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:34.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.1.pli: Anādiyitvā purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ navaṃ nisīdanasanthataṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.1.eng: When having a new sitting blanket made without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:35.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.1.pli: Eḷakalomāni paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaṃ atikkāmento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.1.eng: When receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ tiyojanaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.2.eng: when one goes beyond 40 kilometers with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:36.3.eng: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā eḷakalomāni dhovāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.1.eng: When having an unrelated nun wash wool, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.2.eng: when one is having it washed, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:37.3.eng: when one has had it washed, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.1.eng: When receiving money, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.2.eng: when one is in the process of taking it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:38.3.eng: when one has taken it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.1.pli: Nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.1.eng: When engaging in various kinds of trade involving money, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.2.eng: when one is in the process of trading, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:39.3.eng: when one has traded, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.1.pli: Nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.1.eng: When engaging in various kinds of barter, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.2.eng: when one is in the process of bartering, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:40.3.eng: when one has bartered, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:41.1.eng: The second subchapter on silk is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.1.pli: Atirekapattaṃ dasāhaṃ atikkāmento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.1.eng: When keeping an extra almsbowl for more than ten days, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:42.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.1.pli: Ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.1.eng: When exchanging an almsbowl with fewer than five mends for a new almsbowl, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.2.eng: when one is in the process of exchanging it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:43.3.eng: when one has exchanged it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.1.pli: Bhesajjāni paṭiggahetvā sattāhaṃ atikkāmento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.1.eng: When receiving tonics and then keeping them for more than seven days, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:44.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.1.pli: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.1.eng: When looking for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of summer, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.2.eng: when one is in the process of looking for it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.3.eng: when one has looked for it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:45.3.comm: That is, one has obtained it. This interpretation is required by the fact that it is an offense entailing relinquishment.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.1.pli: Bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā kupito anattamano acchindanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.1.eng: When giving a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.2.eng: when one is in the process of taking it back, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:46.3.eng: when one has taken it back, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.1.pli: Sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.1.eng: When asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.2.eng: when one is having it woven, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:47.3.eng: when one has had it woven, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.1.pli: Pubbe appavārito aññātakassa gahapatikassa tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.1.eng: When, without first being invited, one goes to an unrelated householder’s weavers and specifies the kind of robe-cloth one wants, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.2.eng: when one is in the process of specifying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:48.3.eng: when one has specified it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.1.pli: Accekacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.1.eng: When receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:49.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.1.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.1.eng: When storing one of one’s three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:50.2.eng: an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.1.pli: Jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.1.eng: When diverting to oneself material support that one knows was intended for the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.2.eng: when one is in the process of diverting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:51.3.eng: when one has diverted it, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.1.eng: The third subchapter on almsbowls is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:52.2.eng: The thirty rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.0.1.eng: 5. The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.1.eng: When lying in full awareness, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.2.eng: When lying in full awareness, one commits five kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3.pli: Pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.3.eng: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4.pli: bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.4.eng: when one groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5.pli: “yo te vihāre vasati, so bhikkhu arahā”ti bhaṇati, paṭivijānantassa āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.5.eng: when one says, “The monk who stays in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.6.eng: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.7.eng: when one lies in full awareness, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:53.8.pli: sampajānamusāvādaṃ bhāsanto imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.1.eng: When speaking abusively, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.2.eng: when one speaks abusively to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:54.3.eng: when one speaks abusively to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.1.eng: When engaging in malicious talebearing, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.2.eng: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is fully ordained, one commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:55.3.eng: when one engages in malicious talebearing to one who is not fully ordained, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.1.pli: Anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vācento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.1.eng: When instructing a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.2.eng: when one is in the process of instructing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:56.3.eng: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.1.pli: Anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.1.eng: When lying down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.2.eng: when one is in the process of lying down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:57.3.eng: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.1.pli: Mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.1.eng: When lying down in the same sleeping place as a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.2.eng: when one is in the process of lying down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:58.3.eng: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.1.pli: Mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.1.eng: When giving a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.2.eng: when one is in the process of teaching, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:59.3.eng: for every line, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.1.pli: Anupasampannassa uttarimanussadhammaṃ bhūtaṃ ārocento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.1.eng: When truthfully telling a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.2.eng: when one is in the process of telling, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:60.3.eng: when one has finished telling, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.1.pli: Bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.1.eng: When telling a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.2.eng: when one is in the process of telling, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:61.3.eng: when one has finished telling, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.1.eng: When digging the earth, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.2.eng: when one is in the process of digging, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:62.3.eng: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:63.1.eng: The first subchapter on lying is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.1.eng: When destroying a plant, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.2.eng: when one is having it cut down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:64.3.eng: for every strike, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.1.eng: When speaking evasively, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.2.pli: Anāropite aññavādake aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.2.eng: when one speaks evasively without having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.3.pli: āropite aññavādake aññenaññaṃ paṭicarati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:65.3.eng: when one speaks evasively after having been charged with evasive speech, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.1.eng: When complaining about a monk, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.2.eng: when one is in the process of complaining, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:66.3.eng: when one has complained, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.1.pli: Saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.1.eng: When taking a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and putting it outside, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ leḍḍupātaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.2.eng: when one goes beyond the distance of a stone’s throw with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:67.3.eng: when one goes beyond with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.1.eng: When putting out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ parikkhepaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.2.eng: when one crosses the boundary with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:68.3.eng: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubbupagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.1.eng: When arranging one’s sleeping place, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, in a way that encroaches on a monk that one knows arrived there before oneself, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.2.eng: when one is in the process of lying down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:69.3.eng: when one is lying down, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ kupito anattamano saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.1.eng: When angrily throwing a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.2.eng: when one is in the process of throwing him out, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:70.3.eng: when one has thrown him out, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.1.eng: When sitting down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.2.eng: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:71.3.eng: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.1.pli: Dvattipariyāye adhiṭṭhahitvā tatuttari adhiṭṭhahanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.1.eng: When applying more than two or three courses, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.2.eng: when one is in the process of applying them, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:72.3.eng: when one has applied them, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.1.pli: Jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñcanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.1.eng: When pouring water that one knows contains living beings onto grass or clay, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.2.eng: when one is in the process pouring, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:73.3.eng: when one has finished pouring, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:74.1.eng: The second subchapter on plants is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.1.pli: Asammato bhikkhuniyo ovadanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.1.eng: When instructing the nuns without being appointed, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.2.eng: when one is in the process of instructing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:75.3.eng: when one has finished instructing, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.1.pli: Atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.1.eng: When instructing the nuns after sunset, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.2.eng: when one is in the process of instructing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:76.3.eng: when one has finished instructing, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.1.pli: Bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.1.eng: When one goes to the nuns’ dwelling place and instructs the nuns, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.2.eng: when one is in the process of instructing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:77.3.eng: when one has finished instructing, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.1.pli: “Āmisahetu bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī”ti bhaṇanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.1.eng: When saying that the monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.2.eng: when one is in the process of saying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:78.3.eng: when one has said it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ dento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.1.eng: When giving robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.2.eng: when one is in the process of giving it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:79.3.eng: when one has given it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.1.eng: When sewing a robe for an unrelated nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.2.eng: when one is in the process of sewing it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:80.3.eng: for every stitch, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.1.eng: When traveling by arrangement with a nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.2.eng: when one is in the process of traveling, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:81.3.eng: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.1.eng: When boarding a boat by arrangement with a nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.2.eng: when one is in the process of boarding, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:82.3.eng: when one has boarded, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.1.pli: Jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.1.eng: When eating almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:83.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.1.eng: When sitting down in private alone with a nun, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.2.eng: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:84.3.eng: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:85.1.eng: The third subchapter on the instruction is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.1.pli: Tatuttari āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.1.eng: When eating alms too often at a public guesthouse, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:86.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.1.eng: When eating in a group, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:87.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.1.eng: When eating one meal before another, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:88.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.1.pli: Dvattipattapūre pūve paṭiggahetvā tatuttari paṭiggaṇhanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.1.eng: When accepting more than two or three bowlfuls of cookies, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.2.eng: when one is in the process of taking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:89.3.eng: when one has finished taking, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.1.pli: Bhuttāvī pavārito anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.1.eng: When one has finished one’s meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eats fresh or cooked food that is not left over, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:90.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.1.eng: When inviting a monk who has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.2.pli: Tassa vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.2.eng: when, because of what one says, the other receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:91.3.eng: when the meal is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.1.pli: Vikāle khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.1.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food at the wrong time, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:92.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.1.pli: Sannidhikārakaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.1.eng: When storing and then eating fresh or cooked food, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:93.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.1.pli: Paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.1.eng: When eating fine foods that one has requested for oneself, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:94.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.1.pli: Adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āharanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.1.eng: When eating food that has not been given, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:95.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:96.1.eng: The fourth subchapter on eating is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.1.pli: Acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.1.eng: When personally giving fresh or cooked food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.2.eng: when one is in the process of giving, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:97.3.eng: when one has given, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ—“ehāvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā”ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.1.eng: When one says to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, whether one has had food given to him or not, sends him away, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.2.eng: when one is in the process of sending him away, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:98.3.eng: when one has sent him away, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.1.pli: Sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.1.eng: When sitting down intruding on a lustful couple, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.2.eng: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:99.3.eng: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.1.eng: When sitting down in private on a concealed seat with a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.2.eng: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:100.3.eng: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.1.eng: When sitting down in private alone with a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.2.eng: when one is in the process of sitting down, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:101.3.eng: when one is seated, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.1.pli: Nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.1.eng: When one is invited to a meal, and then visits families beforehand or afterwards, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.2.eng: when one crosses the threshold with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:102.3.eng: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.1.pli: Tatuttari bhesajjaṃ viññāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.1.eng: When asking for too many tonics, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.2.eng: when one is in the process of asking, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:103.3.eng: when one has asked, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.1.pli: Uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gacchanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.1.eng: When going to see an army, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.2.eng: when one is in the process of going, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:104.3.eng: wherever one stands to see it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.1.pli: Atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.1.eng: When staying with the army for more than three nights, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.2.eng: when one is staying, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:105.3.eng: when one has stayed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.1.eng: When going to a battle, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.2.eng: when one is in the process of going, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:106.3.eng: wherever one stands to see it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:107.1.eng: The fifth subchapter on naked ascetics is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.1.eng: When drinking an alcoholic drink, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to drink, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:108.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.1.eng: When one makes a monk laugh by tickling, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.2.eng: when one is in the process of making him laugh, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:109.3.eng: when one has made him laugh, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.1.eng: When playing in water, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.2.eng: when one is playing in water less than ankle deep, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:110.3.eng: when one is playing in water more than ankle deep, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.1.eng: When being disrespectful, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.2.eng: when one is in the process of doing it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:111.3.eng: when one has done it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.1.eng: When scaring a monk, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.2.eng: when one is in the process of scaring him, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:112.3.eng: when one has scared him, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.1.pli: Jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.1.eng: When one lights a fire and warms oneself, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.2.eng: when one is in the process of lighting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:113.3.eng: when one has lit it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.1.eng: When bathing at intervals of less than a half-month, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.2.eng: when one is in the process of bathing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:114.3.eng: when the bath is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.1.pli: Anādiyitvā tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.1.eng: When using a new robe without first applying one of the three kinds of stains, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.2.eng: when one is using it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:115.3.eng: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.1.pli: Bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇerassa vā sāmaṇeriyā vā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.1.eng: When assigning the ownership of a robe to a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun, and then using it without the other first relinquishing it, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.1.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.2.eng: when one is using it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:116.3.eng: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.1.pli: Bhikkhussa pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidhento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.1.eng: When hiding a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.2.eng: when one is in the process of hiding it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:117.3.eng: when one has hid it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:118.1.eng: The sixth subchapter of alcoholic drinks is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.0.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.1.pli: Sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropento kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.1.eng: When intentionally killing a living being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.2.pli: Sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropento catasso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.2.eng: When intentionally killing a living being, one commits four kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.3.pli: Anodissa opātaṃ khaṇati—“yo koci papatitvā marissatī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.3.eng: when one digs a non-specific pit, thinking, “Whatever falls into it will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.4.pli: manusso tasmiṃ papatitvā marati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.4.eng: when a person falls into it and dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.5.pli: yakkho vā peto vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggaho vā tasmiṃ papatitvā marati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.5.eng: when a spirit, ghost, or animal in human form falls into it and dies, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.6.pli: tiracchānagato tasmiṃ papatitvā marati, āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.6.eng: when an animal falls into it and dies, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:119.7.pli: sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropento imā catasso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.1.pli: Jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.1.eng: When using water that one knows contains living beings, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.2.eng: when one is using it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:120.3.eng: when one has used it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.1.pli: Jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.1.eng: When reopening a legal issue that one knows has been legitimately settled, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.2.eng: when one is in the process of reopening it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:121.3.eng: when one has reopened it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:122.1.pli: Bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:122.1.eng: When knowingly concealing a monk’s grave offense, one commits one kind of offense: an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.1.pli: Jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.1.eng: When giving the full ordination to a person one knows is less than twenty years old, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.2.eng: when one is in the process of giving the full ordination, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:123.3.eng: when one has given the full ordination, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.1.pli: Jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.1.eng: When knowingly traveling by arrangement with a group of thieves, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.2.eng: when one is in the process of traveling, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:124.3.eng: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.1.eng: When traveling by arrangement with a woman, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.2.eng: when one is in the process of traveling, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:125.3.eng: when one has traveled, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.1.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.1.eng: When not giving up a bad view when pressed for the third time, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.2.eng: after the motion, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:126.3.eng: when the last announcement is finished, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.1.pli: Jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.1.eng: When living with a monk who one knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.1.comm: “Such things” and “that view” refer to the idea that sexual intercourse is not an obstacle to spiritual progress, see Bu Pc 68:1.49.1.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.2.eng: when one is living with him, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:127.3.eng: when one has lived with him, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.1.pli: Jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇuddesaṃ upalāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.1.eng: When befriending a novice monastic who one knows has been expelled in this way, one commits two kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.1.comm: For the meaning of “in this way”, see Bu Pc 70:1.46.1.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.2.eng: when one befriends him, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:128.3.eng: when one has befriended him, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:129.1.eng: The seventh subchapter on containing living beings is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.1.pli: Bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno—“na tāvāhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchissāmī”ti bhaṇanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.1.eng: When legitimately corrected by the monks, saying, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law”, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.2.eng: when one is in the process of saying it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:130.3.eng: when one has said it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:131.1.eng: When disparaging the Monastic Law, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:131.2.eng: when one is in the process of disparaging it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:131.3.eng: when one has disparaged it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:132.1.eng: When deceiving, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:132.2.eng: when one deceives without having been charged with deception, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:132.3.eng: when one deceives after having been charged with deception, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:133.1.pli: Bhikkhussa kupito anattamano pahāraṃ dento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:133.1.eng: When hitting a monk in anger, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:133.2.eng: when one is hitting, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:133.3.eng: when one has hit, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:134.1.pli: Bhikkhussa kupito anattamano talasattikaṃ uggiranto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:134.1.eng: When raising a hand in anger against a monk, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:134.2.eng: when one raises it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:134.3.eng: when one has raised it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:135.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:135.1.eng: When groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing suspension, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:135.2.eng: when one is in the process of making the charge, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:135.3.eng: when one has made the charge, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.1.pli: Bhikkhussa sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.1.eng: When intentionally making a monk anxious, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.2.eng: when one is in the process of doing it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:136.3.eng: when one has done it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.1.pli: Bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.1.eng: When eavesdropping on monks who are arguing and disputing, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.2.eng: when going with the intention to listen, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:137.3.eng: wherever one stands to listen, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.1.pli: Dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.1.eng: When one gives one’s consent to legitimate legal procedures and then criticizes them afterwards, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.2.eng: when one is criticizing, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:138.3.eng: when one has criticized, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.1.pli: Saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.1.eng: When, without first giving one’s consent, one gets up from one’s seat and leaves while the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.2.eng: when one is in the process of going beyond arm’s reach of the gathering, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:139.3.eng: when one has gone beyond, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.1.pli: Samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.1.eng: When one gives out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.2.eng: when one is criticizing it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:140.3.eng: when one has criticized it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.1.pli: Jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.1.eng: When diverting to an individual material support that one knows was intended for the Sangha, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.2.eng: when one is in the process of diverting it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:141.3.eng: when one has diverted it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:142.1.eng: The eighth subchapter on legitimately is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.1.pli: Pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito rañño antepuraṃ pavisanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.1.eng: When entering the royal compound without first being announced, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.2.eng: when one crosses the threshold with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:143.3.eng: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.1.eng: When picking up something precious, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.2.eng: when one is in the process of taking hold of it, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:144.3.eng: when one has taken hold of it, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.1.pli: Santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.1.eng: When entering an inhabited area at the wrong time without informing an available monk, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ parikkhepaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.2.eng: when one crosses the boundary with the first foot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:145.3.eng: when one crosses with the second foot, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.1.pli: Aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.1.eng: When having a needle case made from bone, ivory, or horn, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:146.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.1.eng: When having a bed or a bench made that exceeds the right height, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:147.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.1.pli: Mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.1.eng: When having a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:148.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ nisīdanaṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.1.eng: When having a sitting mat made that exceeds the right size, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:149.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.1.eng: When having an itch-covering cloth made that exceeds the right size, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:150.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ vassikasāṭikaṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.1.eng: When having a rainy-season robe made that exceeds the right size, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.2.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:151.3.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.1.pli: Sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ kārāpento kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.1.eng: When having a robe made that is the standard robe size, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.2.pli: Sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ kārāpento dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.2.eng: When having a robe made that is the standard robe size, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.3.eng: when one is having it made, then for the effort there is an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.4.eng: when one has had it made, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:152.5.pli: sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ kārāpento imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:153.1.eng: The ninth subchapter on kings is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:153.2.eng: The section on minor rules is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.0.eng: 6. The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.1.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food that was received directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.2.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.2.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food that was received directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.3.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.4.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:154.5.pli: aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā vosāsantiyā na nivāretvā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.1.eng: When eating without having restrained a nun who is giving directions, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:155.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.1.pli: Sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.1.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from families designated as “in training”, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.2.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:156.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.1.pli: Āraññakesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.1.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside a wilderness monastery without first making an announcement, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.2.pli: Āraññakesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.2.eng: When eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside a wilderness monastery without first making an announcement, one commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.3.eng: when one receives with the intention to eat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.4.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:157.5.pli: āraññakesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanto imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:158.1.eng: The four offenses entailing acknowledgment are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.0.2.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāsento kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one wears one’s sarong hanging down in front or behind, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.2.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāsento ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.2.eng: When, out of disrespect, one wears one’s sarong hanging down in front or behind, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:159.4.pli: anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento nivāsento imaṃ ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:160.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambento pārupanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:160.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one wears one’s upper robe hanging down in front or behind, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:161.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:161.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area with one’s body uncovered, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:162.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyaṃ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:162.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sits in an inhabited area with one’s body uncovered, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:163.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaṃ vā pādaṃ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:163.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area, playing with one’s hands and feet, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:164.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaṃ vā pādaṃ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:164.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sits in an inhabited area, playing with one’s hands and feet, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:165.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:165.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area, looking here and there, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:166.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokento antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:166.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sits in an inhabited area, looking here and there, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:167.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca ukkhittakāya antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:167.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area with a lifted robe, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:168.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:168.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sits in an inhabited area with a lifted robe, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:169.1.eng: The first subchapter on evenly all around is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:170.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca ujjagghikāya antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:170.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one laughs loudly while walking in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:171.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca ujjagghikāya antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:171.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one laughs loudly while sitting in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:172.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ karonto antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:172.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one is noisy while walking in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:173.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca uccāsaddaṃ mahāsaddaṃ karonto antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:173.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one is noisy while sitting in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:174.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:174.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sways one’s body while walking in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:175.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca kāyappacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:175.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sways one’s body while sitting in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:176.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:176.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one swings one’s arms while walking in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:177.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca bāhuppacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:177.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one swings one’s arms while sitting in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:178.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca sīsappacālakaṃ antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:178.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sways one’s head while walking in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:179.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca sīsappacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:179.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sways one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:180.1.eng: The second subchapter on laughing loudly is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.2:181.0.eng: The subchapter on hands on hips

pli-tv-pvr1.2:181.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca khambhakato antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:181.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area with one’s hands on one’s hips, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:182.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca khambhakato antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:182.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one sits in an inhabited area with one’s hands on one’s hips, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:183.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca oguṇṭhito antaraghare gacchanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr1.2:183.1.eng: When, out of disrespect, one walks in an inhabited area with a covered head, one commits one kind of offense:

pli-tv-pvr1.2:184.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca oguṇṭhito antaraghare nisīdanto ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
